pages.text: The $(item)Summoner$() converts essence of creatures past into soulus in order to create random descendants. The alignment and fuel source (essence) of a summoner is provided by a $(l:summoning/soulbook)Soulbook$().$(p)In order to craft a summoner, you will need to collect a few other items.

You have now created an ingot of what I've dubbed 'Endersteel'. This metal is similar to iron in density and hardness, but it's also a better conductor for soulus.$(p)$(o)Note: This is probably over your head; that's fine. You haven't researched soulus manipulation for as long as I have.
You now have your very first summoner. Place it down and insert a $(l:summoning/soulbook)Soulbook$() to begin to restore Animalia.

As you may have expected, it takes a long time for your summoner to recreate life. It also takes another ingredient: your presence.$(p)The reasoning is simple, but unfortunate; it's impossible to create something living from only remains. To summon a creature, the summoner will leech away your soul. Don't worry, though, you won't feel a thing. Probably. And your soul will regenerate over time.
To speed up the summoning process, you can insert Existential Essence. It must contain some essence matching the creature being summoned.

pages.title: Upgrading the Summoner
pages.text: There are multiple ways I've found in which you can improve your summoner. These chapters document each.
